intro: Villadia alpina, commonly known as the alpine villadia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes, often in alpine meadows. Its slender stems are adorned with small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, spicy scent when crushed, contributing to its ecological and potential medicinal significance.
